Name: Pieks
Description:
Fend off the mosquitoes...

The players roll the dice. Whoever has mosquitoes is bitten, whoever has a swat can ward off mosquitoes. You can still modify your result. The game ends as soon as a player has received 10 mosquito bites.

—description from the publisher

Name: Piratengold
Description:
As pirates, the players try to prevent losing all their gold, because everyone wants to get their hands on the shiny metal.

The dice are rolled to see whether gold has been rolled or whether the skulls predominate. Without gold it becomes dangerous...

—description from the publisher

Name: Schatzkammer
Description:
Be the first player to find four identical gems.

The players roll the dice and advance in the treasure chamber. But you can only score points if you find the right gems. The game ends as soon as a player has rolled (i.e. marked) a gemstone type four times.

—description from the publisher

Name: Waldbären
Description:
The players try to find as many bears as possible in their forest.

The dice are rolled and depending on the symbols achieved, you can either find bears or only encounter useless trees. But if you are lucky, you can also push them onto the other players' eyes or even steal bears from them. In the end, you need many bears and should have them in the right places.

—description from the publisher

Name: Marvel Dice Throne
Description:
In Marvel Dice Throne , you become one of eight of Marvel's most famous heroes, including Black Panther, Captain Marvel, Black Widow, Scarlet Witch, Loki, Thor, Doctor Strange, and Miles Morales Spider-man! Every Marvel Dice Throne hero was painstakingly designed and balanced to provide the most thematic experience possible, allowing you to truly embody your favorite heroes like no other game. Featuring all-new mechanisms and asymmetrical designs, these are our most innovative and exciting heroes yet.

Marvel Dice Throne is a heart-pumping, fast-playing game of skilled card play and dice manipulation supporting multiple modes of play, including 1v1, 2v2, 3v3, 2v2v2, or free-for-all.

Attack your opponents and activate abilities by rolling your hero's unique set of five dice. Accumulate combat points and spend them on cards that have a large range of effects, such as granting permanent hero upgrades, applying status effects, and manipulating dice directly (yours, your teammate's, or even your opponent's).

All 8 heroes are compatible with the entire Dice Throne ecosystem
Use upgrade cards to improve your hero abilities as the game progresses
Play action cards strategically to manipulate dice and surprise your foe
Features a deluxe, highly functional, Battle Chest storage system
Each hero in the Battle Chest has their own beautiful set of custom swirl dice

—description from the publisher
Families: Misc: Watch It Played How To Videos

Name: Inspector Penguin
Description:
Inspector Penguin is a bluffing card game for 2-4 players. The goal of the game is to craft jewelry with normal and magical pebbles. Magical pebbles are forbidden and risky to use, but give you a bonus action. Beware of the Inspector Penguin who can block you from crafting jewelry if they uncover a magical pebble. Use your action cards strategically to help you dodge the inspector, or help you sniff out magical pebbles.

Test your luck and bluffing skills in this fast-paced, highly interactive (cute) card game.

—description from the designer

Name: Tabletop Archaeology 101
Description: Tabletop Archaeology 101 is a simple roll table dice game where each player takes on the role of a Hollywood archaeologist. Your rolls will determine what you find, whether you trigger traps, and if you encounter raiders. Welcome to the dig site.

Name: Blokk! Hazard: The Expansion
Description:
In Blokk! Hazard you are the Engineer and have been assigned to obstruct your opponent known as the Architect, in order to construct The Tower.

To start a game, Engineers are given 10 complex Hazard blocks. Architects select one of the three difficulty modes: Hand-pick their own blocks, roll the dice, or draw a card from the deck. Architects use a 5x5 grid to start building their tower.
But Architects beware: your opponent’s blocks will count against you!

Name: Nano Battle: Epic Mini Figure Combat
Description:
A tabletop combat game system using 1.75 inch little rubber keshi figures called Nanoids. Take control of Nanoids as an Operator, your task is to close the power hungry rifts opening all over the world.

Use your 6 Command cards to simultaneously activate your Nanoids in Nano Battle! Each card has a number indicating how many seconds it takes for your Nanoid to act in battle, a Dodge is almost instant while a Super move might take some time. Deplete each others Life Sparks while avoiding peril on the Nano Fields stabilizing the rifts.

Be careful, once your last Command card in hand is activated each round the rift consumes its data, never to be used in this match again. 21 total choices before you run out of commands and your Nanoid goes rogue. Can you defeat your opponent while your Nanoid is choosing its own commands?

An expandable game system of Rumble and Nanoid Packs. Rumble Packs provide everything for 2 players to Nano Battle and can be combined or used stand-alone. Nanoid Packs add more colorful Nanoids to your arsenal of little warriors. More pack types to come such as Story and Megoids.

Name: Necromunda: House of Shadow
Description:
Discover the mysterious origins and agendas of House Delaque, from their plots and schemes against the other Houses to the truth behind their steady spread across the Hive world.

Inside you will find:

1) Updated rules for creating and running House Delaque gangs including new rules for Psy-Gheists or the preternatural assassins and saboteurs known as the Nacht-Ghuls.

2) New rules for adding Hired guns as well as Delaque specific Dramatis Personae such as Yageloth the Whisperer and the terrifying Servant of the Silent Ones.

3) New sub-plots, a unique Delaque skill set, terrain and House features

4) New Scenario's specific for the House of Shadow

Name: Don't Cross Me!
Description:
Guile! Vengeance! Buttmunchery!

Build new sets and runs that "cross" your opponents' to earn specialty cards fromt he Devious Deck! Then use these "Deevies" to hose over your closest friends and family as. you trategize your way to victory!

Name: On Porpoise
Description:
The best dressed dolphin takes the ocean in this fast paced card game.  You will be challenged by polka dots, paisley patterns and predators as you race to get rid of your cards first.  Keep a look out because there are more than just sharks in this water. 
Catch the cards played on porpoise and you might live to tell the tale.

Cards are divided evenly between all players and placed in face down stacks. In tge center of tge table are the three porpoise cards, the head (which needs a hat), the body (which needs a jacket) and the tail (which every well dressed porpoise should cover).  All players play cards simultaneously in an attempt to match the existing clothing patterns or clothing colors currently played on the porpoise in the center of the table. The first player to play their entire card stack wins the game!

Name: Escape Quest: Alone in Salem
Description:
Embark on a series of standalone adventures in which YOU will be the main character, during which to move forward you must solve mysterious puzzles to avoid all the traps and obstacles in your way. But beware! Only faultless logic and clever deduction will let you beat all the riddles and advance through the story. Will you be up to the challenge?

Escape Quest is an adventure gamebook series born of a collaboration between Ynnis’ publishing team and Don’t Panic Games’ design team. It is the  fruit of all our combined knowledge of game design and book publishing. Much more than just a “gamified book” or a “book-like game”, we put great care in conceiving each of those volumes - collaborating with award-winning game designers, authors and illustrators - to create an immersive, fun experience that is both a great book and a great game.

ALONE IN SALEM

You say witch like it’s a bad thing!

You are on vacation and treating yourself to a famous “Salem Witch Tour” in the village well-known for its witch trials centuries before. But when you decide to leave your group, the visit quickly turns into an occult nightmare! Find your way into the museum and escape the clutches of a mysterious cult. Signs and omens are everywhere, and your doom seems unavoidable. Will you have the wits to survive? Alone in Salem, do you have what it takes to make it through the night?

—description from the publisher

Name: Escape Quest: Lupin's Challenge
Description:
Embark on a series of standalone adventures in which YOU will be the main character, during which to move forward you must solve mysterious puzzles to avoid all the traps and obstacles in your way. But beware! Only faultless logic and clever deduction will let you beat all the riddles and advance through the story. Will you be up to the challenge?

Escape Quest is an adventure gamebook series born of a collaboration between Ynnis’ publishing team and Don’t Panic Games’ design team. It is the  fruit of all our combined knowledge of game design and book publishing. Much more than just a “gamified book” or a “book-like game”, we put great care in conceiving each of those volumes - collaborating with award-winning game designers, authors and illustrators - to create an immersive, fun experience that is both a great book and a great game.

LUPIN'S CHALLENGE

Cat-burglar extraordinaire!

Travel to Paris in the steam-powered era of the gentleman burglar, Arsène Lupin as he makes an announcement that shocks the shadowy community of the underworld to its core: He has decided it is time to pass on his knowledge and so issued a challenge. The first thief who can steal a certain prize jewel will become his new apprentice and learn all of his secrets! He has left puzzles and riddles that could slow you down or speed you on your way. Study your mark carefully, to plan for the heist of the century and succeed before anyone else. Can you become Lupin’s new apprentice?

—description from the publisher

Name: Chimp!
Description:
CHIMP! is a game based on definitions of weird and wonderful words. Can you tell which are fakes and which are strange but true? Can you fool the others into making the wrong guesses? Can you make up some CHIMP! definitions of your own? Who will be first to score 25 points and win the game?

Take turns as a Reader, and whenever you are not the Reader, you are the Guesser. Up to 8 can join in and everyone is in play all the time. It’s great fun for those who love words and those who delight in telling lies with a straight face.

One each card there is one true definition and 2 fake definitions, but you also have the option of devising a 'CHIMP' which is a fake definition of your own, a tactic that offers more points.

CHIMP! is a pick-up-and-play-anywhere game that takes no setting up, is easy to learn and rewards mischief-makers from age 12 up.

—description from the designer

Name: Murder & Friends
Description:
Murder & Friends is a box with 2 scenario of murder party inside.
The particularity of this game is that there is no game master who organise the game. Everybody can play.

Each player receive a booklet at the beginning of the game with the description of his character. They will have to question each other to find the murderer. 
A central board with different path with question cards can help solving the crime. But the murderer can influence the group to follow the path allowing him to escape and win the game.

Name: MountStop!
Description:
In MountStop!, each player is a seasoned climb leader and wants to prove to the world that they are the best; but so as a few others! For that, they need to win the biggest mountain climbing competition in the world by leading different teams to conquer the most famous mountains in the world.

In your turn, choose which mountain you want to climb and which of your teams you want to lead on this expedition. The higher the mountain the more points you’ll get if you reach the peak. You can also try to complete one or more of the random quests to gain more points. You’ll climb by rolling dice, one die for each climber on your team.

If all of your climbers are injured, your expedition was a failure and the next player starts his/her turn.

When any player successfully uses all her/his teams to conquer mountains, the game ends and the player with the most points is the winner.

Name: Castle Break
Description:
Castle Break is a Medieval adventure strategy board game with card drafting, trading, scenario/quest completion, and more.

Warriors (the players) have been chosen to represent their Kingdom in this year’s Castle Break Games. Players' task is to complete Quests by collecting Trade Goods, using Tools & Weapons, and harnessing their Magical Powers.

For each Quest completed, players are rewarded in coin. Earn 6 Coins, forge them into keys, and unlock the gates to DRAGON’S TOWER. There a player will free the dragon and achieve the title of this year’s CHAMPION.

Opponents can barter, steal, and outwit you using various powers and opportunities at every turn to achieve their aims.

Name: Observation
Description: Observation is a card game of speed and keen observation. Cats, dogs, wild animals, aliens, and robots have invaded the police station and are running amok.  It will take a sharp-eyed detective to sort this mess out! Find four characters from the same collection faster than your friends or family and then ring the bell! You'll earn a detective badge and collect the cards. But be careful of those pesky penguins, you can count on them to mess up your collection! It's great family fun!!!

Name: Tierra de Misión
Description:
Tierra de Misión is a game of cards and tokens with an educational and integrating purpose in the pastoral history issued by the missionaries of the Catholic faith in the mission of the Argentine Patagonia in a time of dispossession and persecution of the native peoples.

The objective of the game is to have accumulated the highest number of story points at the end of the game.

During three rounds, players select and play cards using a draft similar to 7 Wonders. Players start the rounds with 7-9 cards and 2-3 coins, depending on the player count. The cards have different colors and different scores, with some cards having an economic cost.

The cards stay in the table after each round, and the player with more points at the end is declared as the winner.

Name: Pentecostés
Description:
We cannot keep silent about what we have seen and heard.

Pentecostés is a game for both young people and adults where the book of the acts of the apostles covers by theme and narrative, in which each player must represent an apostle witness to the resurrection and assumption of Jesus Christ who will have to announce and testify to the message of the good news and to be forming their Christian communities encompassing the people of the different social classes of all the people of Israel in that historical period.

The player who has been the emissary with the highest score at the end of the game, adding the points of the cards of each community, plus the additional scores, will become the winner.

The objective of the game is to have accumulated the highest score at the end of the game. Where not only will win the one who accumulated the highest score in the community cards, but also the additional scores of the teaching of Jesus Christ and life goal that each of the players will have will be credited.

In each round, each player has their turn to perform two actions that allow him to:

Obtain Speech tokens: Do conversion actions with God to obtain tokens, to be used soon to obtain community cards.

Proclaim a card: Once you have the corresponding amount of tokens to exchange for one of the available cards, pay the corresponding cost for it to obtain the card you want.

Baptize a card: Once a community card is obtained, it goes on to add points. Now you can baptize it by paying the amount of corresponding baptismal tokens; and thus enhance your game for later.

The game ends once the community deck cards are used up, so there are no cards left to replace on the table. Each player starting with the starting player will have a last turn, where this time he will have the opportunity to do 3 actions to end his game and move on to the summation of points.

Name: Martian Expansion
Description:
An unofficial game set in the universe of The Expanse.

The players are Martians aiming to dominate the Outer Planets by controlling the most spacecraft destined for each planetary system. Each player has five agents who seek to gain control of spacecraft landing in the Docking Bay of Ceres Space Station before freedom fighters from the Outer Planet Alliance (OPA) capture the spacecraft, and before an OPA Uprising occurs which ends the game.

Quick to learn, set-up and play.

Push-your-luck against the other players, the game’s OPA, and the end of game Uprising which increases in likelihood throughout the game.

Solo mode: challenge yourself against the OPA.

Name: La Carpinchada
Description:
La Carpinchada is a game for 2 to 4 players, where each person will have to lead a whole family of capybaras that will seek to dominate most of the entire Argentine wetland field. The first player who manages to dominate more territories than the rest, will become the winner. So the other groups of capybaras will have to look for a place in other territories, we recommend the south of Entre Ríos or north of Buenos Aires.

After setting up the play area, each player will have 4 cards of which they must play 1 on their turn, these will give them control of the number of capybaras to move and the directions or coordinates to move. Or those cards can also be actions of wildlife animals, which will give benefits that will be satisfactory in the game. Then the player will pick a new card from the deck to end their turn.

The game is over when a player wins by mastering his fourth game territory, and positions his domain token.

Name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Karstark Spearmen
Description: This pack contains 12 figures for the game A Song of Ice and Fire.
Families: Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game

Name: Strange but True
Description: Take turns to answer the questions. The first to get 15 correct is the winner

Name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Clegane Brigands
Description: This pack contains 4 figures for the game A Song of Ice and Fire.
Families: Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game

Name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Baratheon Thorn Watch
Description: This pack contains 13 figures for the game A Song of Ice and Fire.
Families: Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game

Name: Drunken Adventures
Description:
Each player should have three 12oz beverages in front of them (alcoholic or nonalcoholic). The game involves rules that can either add sips or remove sips from a player's glass

Each turn players will roll the die and move their bottle cap piece to the corresponding square. There are 36 squares in the game. The squares may have you draw a card, play a mini-game, or require action. Each square will either decrease the number of drinks in your glass or increase your lifespan, so to speak. (I.e. giving drinks increases your glasses capacity while taking drinks lowers it)

Be among the first three players to make it to the finish line without finishing your three drinks. The game is a race to the finish with a gold medal (1st). silver (2nd), and bronze (3rd).

After a player gets sent back to the start or finishes their three drinks and is forced back to the start, they are not required to follow the “lifeline” rule but must follow the drinking rules.

The game ends when three players have reached the finish, achieving gold, silver, and bronze. Once a player has reached the finish, they are exempt from mini-games or drinking aspects of the game (unless they choose to join the fun).

Name: 3DMILL
Description:
3DMILL is a three-dimensional strategy game for two players. Built on an ingenious board frame structure, 3DMILL breaks the limitation of two dimensions and integrates spatial concept into the game, thus stimulates spatial perception, cognitive skills and interactions between players.

Inspired by the classic game "Nine Men’s Morris", 3DMILL applies simple rules but has great strategic depth with more dimensions. Players need to achieve a plurality of forms in which three pieces are in one straight line in a three-dimensional space. It is fun to play for young and old!

Moreover, 3DMILL’s board construction is convenient to be dissembled and stored. Handy tweezers assist players in manual dexterity exercises when placing the game pieces. With a unique crystal-clear looking, the board is not only for playing games, but also an exquisite eye-catcher for distinctive art decoration.

—description from the publisher

Name: Soldier Emperor: Byzantium Eternal
Description:
Our 40th issue tells an unusual tale of alternative history. The Byzantine Empire met its end in 1453, when the Ottoman Turks stormed its ancient capital, Constantinople, and the last emperor died fighting somewhere amidst the carnage. A few outposts would fall over the coming decades, and the Empire would never rise again.

In Byzantium Eternal, we add the Byzantines to our Soldier Emperor game, a Byzantine Empire that never fell. The Empire faced long odds in 1453, but it had miraculously survived even worse odds before. While it’s indeed improbably that the Empire could have survived another 350 years, it was just as improbable for it to have muddled through the previous 350.
Families: Series: Avalanche Press Gold Club Golden Journal Supplements

Name: Zombicide: Ghostbusters Pack #1
Description:
Venkman, Winston, and their companion Slimer take to the streets to battle against Zuul, who spawns Abominations as if there were none on the board!

4 minis with rules, cards and player boards. Contains components to be playable with the 1st and 2nd Editions.

Name: Zombicide: Ghostbusters Pack #2
Description:
Ray and Egon take to the streets to battle against mighty Gozer and Vinz Clortho, who floods Abominations on the board!

4 minis with rules, cards and player boards. Contains components to be playable with the 1st and 2nd Editions.

Name: Zombicide: Ghostbusters Pack #3 – Stay Puft Abomination
Description:
If the Zombie Apocalypse weren’t bad enough, Stay Puft presents the greatest challenge for the Ghostbusters yet. The only way to elliminate him is to cross the streams!

1 mini with cards. Contains components to be playable with the 1st and 2nd Editions.

Name: La Grande Guerre: Western European Field Battles, 1700-1763
Description:
La Grande Guerre is a miniatures wargame designed for entire large battles of the age of Continental linear warfare during the 18th Century.

The rules abstract details the brigade level into combat factors and modifiers. When brigade bases contact one another, the infantry/cavalry combat system combines all actions troops took within musket range of one another, including skirmishing, musketry, and charges, while artillery can also fight at a distance  Simple but accurate mechanics allow players to concentrate on command decisions and the direction of troops, including grand tactical movement of reserves, rather than wade through the minutia of battle or numerous or complicated rules.

Players usually take the role of wing commanders, directing a few divisions, each of several brigades.  
Many battles, such as Rossbach, can be played with one player per side. 
The game rewards historical formations and tactics, while allowing more gifted commanders to innovate within the capabilities of forces during the wars of Spanish and Austrian Succession, and the Seven Years War (in Europe). 
This game inflicts battlefield friction on the execution of command decisions. Each nation’s troop types have historical characteristics that place them in the proper balance with the other forces of their era.

These thoroughly playtested rules are written primarily for the Seven Years War, but have an intrinsic module for the War of Spanish Succession, with just enough adjustments to cover the differences in tactics and operation while keeping most of the same basic rules.  Further expansions may cover the Great Northern War.

If players want to fight all of an 18th Century battle, rather than with some battalions or want to worry more about deployment, concentration of force, combined arms, and the commitment of reserves rather than where might skirmishers be, or when to change from column to line, La Grande Guerre is the game to play.

Sequence of Play:
1. Determine initiative.
2. The army with initiative moves each brigade or battery until all selected units have moved.
3. Resolve all active player combats. Conduct general risk tests.
4. The reacting side moves.
5. Resolve all combat for the reactive side. Conduct general risk tests.
6. Check for victory conditions. Proceed to next cycle.

–Description from the publisher
Families: History: War of the Spanish Succession

Name: The Phantom: The Card Game – Terror in Mawitaan
Description:
The terrorist Chatu "The Python" is back in Bangalla and only you can stop him from harming innocent bystanders.
based on Tony DePauls first Sunday story, published in newspaper between April 6th and September 28th of 2003 and was drawn by Graham Nolan.

Terror in Mawitaan includes a new Adventure with rewards, the keyword Tough and the concept of Side-Missions, new Foes and new Allies.

Name: Ziqqurat
Description:
Two card are turned face up. Each card shows two letters. The first player to find a word containing all letters gains a level for his ziqqurat. Then he changes one card. The first to complete his ziqqurat wins.

—description from the designer

Published on History Kids, italian edition, issue #11.

Name: Illa
Description:
In Quechuan, Illa means the light, the origin, the beginning of.

Illa is a cooperative game. On your turn, you play a card on a path build in the beginning of the game and then continue the story previously told by others players. The game ends when the last space on the path is filled with a card. The number of round is decided by the players in the beginning of the game (Usually around 12 rounds). After each cards, other players vote from 0 to 5 regarding your story. At the and of the game, the score of the team is the total of all the votes.

The only limit is your imagination.

You can play Illa with your children building a fairy tale with them, or as part of a group of friends, workers to learn to work together. The game is based on communication.

Every tales will be very differents from each others, using cards based on 4 elements representing archetypes. 144 unique cards by (36 by elements) + 30 others unique cards for the path are part of the games, giving a huge replaybility.

—description from the designer

Name: Die Händler vom Taubertal: Das Kartenspiel
Description:
This card game for 2 to 4 players adapts the classic board game with new rules and an exciting game mechanic for the whole family!

The players pick cards from the stack. These cards in four different colours have numbers from 1 to 4. In every turn, you either can draw two cards from the stack or you can play out specific cards to perform an action. But watch out for the Black Knight!

The players get goods like wine and flour and try to sell these goods for a good price. They then invest these coins in cannonballs. As soon as a player manages to own three or four cannonballs (according to the number of players) he wins the game.

Name: Prepper
Description:
Don’t be scared – be prepared!

Do you think you’ve got what it takes to handle things when the shit really hits the fan? There’s only one way to find out…

If you’ve ever wondered whether or not you can weather a huge, destructive storm or total infrastructure collapse using nothing more than your wits, an axe, a paracord bracelet, a bottle of vodka and a dog, then this is the game for you.

The first main goal in Prepper is to build up a cupboard filled with everything you need to get through a crisis. While you’re doing so, you advance around the board and pick up extra items and skills by testing your own prepping, survival and general knowledge and abilities, during a fun and challenging trivia round in which you’ll answer questions and also interact with your surroundings and each other. By the end of the first round, you’ll have a great prepper cupboard – packed with items that could range from a packet of painkillers to a domestic electricity generator. So far, so good. Right?

Wrong. Prepper is a game of two halves. And in the second half, things really go south. You see, once you’ve tested your knowledge and built up your prep store as best you can, disaster strikes. What this disaster is, you don’t know for sure. It could be anything from getting lost in the forest to a total infrastructure collapse. And it’s happening to you, right now, and you need to do something about it.

A lot of people think they have the gumption needed to make it through a crisis. In Prepper, you get the chance to find out. And it’s not just about having the right stuff in your cupboard. Far from it, in fact. It’s also about having the skill to come up with creative solutions using only what you have at hand. It tests your ability to barter with your friends for the things you know you need right now – and which you’re also going to have to convince them that they won’t need any time soon. And, it measures your willingness to help others in their times of need – after all, one day you might need their help, too.

But more than anything else, it’s about using your wits and your kit to get through tough situations – which might range from a cut thumb or a power cut to the roof literally being torn off your house – while still, somehow, keeping it all about the LOLs.

You’ve got what it takes to play Prepper. In fact, you were born ready. Now all you have to do is prove it.

—description from the designer

Name: Alice's Nightmare in Wonderland
Description:
Several years after the events of Alice's Adventures in Wonderland and Through the Looking Glass, Alice finds herself back in Wonderland and called upon to save the world of playing cards and talking animals from the increasingly deranged Queen of Hearts. But all is not as it first appears in the fluctuating dream world and soon Alice is battling to save herself from the nightmare that is rapidly overtaking the realm.

Have you ever wondered what would have happened if Alice hadn't drunk from the bottle labelled 'Drink Me', or if she hadn't joined the Hatter, the March Hare, and the Dormouse for tea? Well now you can find out. In this game, YOU decide which route Alice should take, which perils to risk, and which of Wonderland's strange denizens to fight. But be warned - whether Alice succeeds in her quest or meets a dire end as the nightmare escalates will be down to the choices YOU make. Are you ready to go back down the rabbit-hole?

This gamebook containts 3 modes to play and few different endings to discover.

—description from the publisher

Name: Fast Check
Description:
Players, attention!!

Flip a card and look at the color on the pile to find the mistake in the challenge you just discovered. The card challenges change with each round and will use your visual perception better than the other players:


     you will have to find the correct word 
     check if the numbers are equal or not that indicated result
     find the differences between images
     build figures with geometric shapes
     count the elements of the indicated color
     order the letters to form correct words


Will you capable of finding out if it's okay or say what's wrong before everyone else?



¡Rápido, presta atención!Dale la vuelta a una carta y fíjate en el color que aparece en el montón para encontrar el error en el reto que acabas de descubrir. Los retos de las cartas cambian en cada ronda y pondrán a prueba tu percepción visual:


     tendrás que encontrar la palabra bien escrita
     comprobar si los números suman el resultado indicado
     encontrar las diferencias entre imágenes 
     construir figuras con formas geométricas
     contar los elementos del color indicado
     ordenar las letras para formar palabras correctas


¿Serás capaz de descubrir si está bien o decir qué es lo que falla antes que los demás?

Name: Guardians of Fire: City of the Damned
Description:
Having vanquished foes abroad, Parsa returned to his home city of Shiraz only to find it in the clutches of terror. Once vibrant and lively streets became dark and deserted, people shut in their homes, trembling in fear. Many houses stand empty; their denizens vanished into the night under the full moon. Parsa's duty as the city watch commander is to uncover the source of this dread and face it, accompanied only by his closest retinue and whatever allies they may find in this cursed city.

—description from the publisher

Name: Expediente Anunnaki: Brujería
Description:
When the archaeologist Nicole Harper decides to go hiking in the Catskill Mountains, north of New York, she is totally unaware of what she is about to uncover in the depths of the forest...
Alone, isolated and being chased by formidable enemies, she will not find it easy to survive. Her escape will become ever-more difficult and uncertain as she soon finds things to be even worse than she had imagined.
But her nightmare does not end there! In the midst of all the confusion, she will come across a great and ancient evil that threatens the future of all humankind. 
Immerse yourself in this frightening adventure and take on the role of Nicole as she comes face to face with a myriad of challenges...

Main Characteristics 

     Relive the classics of old. Make your own adventure and decide how the story develops.
     You will look forward to each and every engagement due to the intense and exciting combat system that allows for various outcomes and possibilities.
     Adult-themed illustrations and story content. You will genuinely be surprised by the plot as well as the complex decision-making system.
     The narrative and background of the story is so well-developed that you will be hooked from the very beginning. As you progress through the adventure, the secrets of the Anunnaki will reveal themselves.
     Solve enigmas, puzzles, and riddles to get equipment, increase your skills, gain access to hidden areas, and much more!
     Expediente Anunnaki. Brujería - Libro 1 ("Anunnaki Files: Witchraft - Book 1") forms part of the universe created by David Velasco, a renown author of novels, books, and roleplaying games in Spain.


—description from the publisher (translated)


Cuando la arqueóloga Nicole Harper decide practicar senderismo en las Montañas de Catskill, al norte de Nueva York, no puede ni imaginar lo que está a punto de descubrir en lo más profundo del bosque… 
Sola y aislada, se enfrentará a una peligrosa carrera para tratar de sobrevivir, perseguida por unos implacables enemigos. Su huida será trepidante y cada vez más arriesgada, pues comprobará que todo es aún peor de lo que había imaginado. 
¡Pero su pesadilla no acabará ahí! En plena vorágine de acontecimientos se topará con un mal aún más grotesco, una amenaza forjada en el albor de los tiempos, capaz de poner en jaque el futuro de toda la humanidad. Prepárate para ponerte en la piel de Nicole en esta aventura temática y altamente inmersiva repleta de horrores y desafíos.Principales características

     Revive las clásicas lecturas de antaño. Vive tu propia aventura y decide cómo se desarrolla la historia.
     Sistema de combate tenso y trepidante, que hará que disfrutes cada enfrentamiento gracias a la riqueza de posibilidades que ofrece.
     Temática y estética adulta. La dureza de su argumento y la complejidad de las decisiones y sistema de juego te sorprenderán.
     Su cuidado trasfondo y narrativa te atraparán desde el principio. A medida que avances en tu aventura, los misterios de los Anunnaki empezarán a ser revelados.
     Resuelve enigmas, puzles y acertijos para conseguir equipo adicional, mejora de tus habilidades, acceder a áreas ocultas y mucho más.
     Expediente Anunnaki. Brujería - Libro 1 forma parte del universo creado por David Velasco, un reputado escritor de novelas, libros y juegos de rol en España.


—description from the publisher

Name: מספרים ואתגרים (Numbers and Challenges)
Description:
The board is filled randomly with tiles with numbers on them. Some are positive and some negative.
One player uses columns and the other uses rows. When a player takes a tile, the next tile must be from the same row or column. When no tile is available to take, the game ends.
The player with the highest numerical total score wins.

—user summary

Name: BattleTech: Savannah/Grasslands Battlemat
Description:
Each map is 34” x 22", the perfect "two-map" size for most games. The maps are high-resolution with great color quality, making them some of the most beautiful and durable BattleTech maps ever produced. The neoprene is also thin for ease of storage, and double-sided for versatility. The primary side includes a never-before published map for one of the following terrain:


     Desert
     Lunar
     Alpine
     Savannah


The secondary side also includes brand-new maps—designed to be used together—as featured in the soon-to-release BattleTech Map Pack: Grasslands. Each of the four BattleMast displays a unique Grasslands map on the back.

Name: BattleTech: Lunar/Grasslands Battlemat
Description:
Each map is 34” x 22", the perfect "two-map" size for most games. The maps are high-resolution with great color quality, making them some of the most beautiful and durable BattleTech maps ever produced. The neoprene is also thin for ease of storage, and double-sided for versatility. The primary side includes a never-before published map for one of the following terrain:


     Desert
     Lunar
     Alpine
     Savannah


The secondary side also includes brand-new maps—designed to be used together—as featured in the soon-to-release BattleTech Map Pack: Grasslands. Each of the four BattleMast displays a unique Grasslands map on the back.

Name: BattleTech: Desert/Grasslands Battlemat
Description:
Each map is 34” x 22", the perfect "two-map" size for most games. The maps are high-resolution with great color quality, making them some of the most beautiful and durable BattleTech maps ever produced. The neoprene is also thin for ease of storage, and double-sided for versatility. The primary side includes a never-before published map for one of the following terrain:


     Desert
     Lunar
     Alpine
     Savannah


The secondary side also includes brand-new maps—designed to be used together—as featured in the soon-to-release BattleTech Map Pack: Grasslands. Each of the four BattleMats displays a unique Grasslands map on the back.

Name: Graal: Promo Cards
Description:
Three additional quest cards: The Gates of Galvoie, Broceliande and The White Lance are available from the publisher as a Print On Demand expansion for the base game.

•••

Trois cartes quêtes supplémentaires et diablement redoutables : les Portes de Galvoie, Brocéliande et la Lanche Blanche. Demandez-les !

Name: Hush 'N Rush
Description:
The forest animals were playing outside and did not notice when evening fell. Now they have to return home, but a wolf somehow fell asleep on the path. How can they get past without being noticed?

Every player has a group of three animals to safely pass the wolf and return home.

Each player rolls the die and must take one of his animals and move as many steps as are shown on the die. Choose with caution, because each animal can only hide from the wolf behind a bush of his shape or behind a stump.

If the player rolls the die to show the eye symbol, the wolf is waking up! All animals that are not behind a stump or a bush of their shape are frightened away, run back to the start, and have to begin again.

The game ends when one of the players succeeds in returning home with all three animals.

—description from the publisher

Name: Spoilers: Edición Definitiva
Description:
5 years after Spoilers: The Game comes Spoilers: Definitive Edition, a recollection of the best, craziest, and funniest movies appeared in the previous sets plus 22 completely new movies.

Players compete in teams to guess the plot of the craziest movies ever filmed. They will get popcorn tokens guessing the correct answer (from the three given) or misleading the rival team to pick up the trap answer.

The team with more popcorn tokens by the end of the third round wins the game.

—description from the publisher
Families: Organizations: Board Games Association of Creators in Spain (LUDO)

Name: Donky Pong
Description:
It’s market day today! Who, if not a child and his friend the donkey, will help you take goods to the market? Let's see whose team will be the first?!

Each turn in Donky Pong, player rolls a die and moves according to rolled symbols. There are five symbols on the die. A donkey an a number shows how many steps you can make with your donkey, a child and a number means the same, but you make steps with a child. A child, a donkey and a number means that you can choose who will make its step. With carrot symbol you can lure your donkey closer to the market and with an ice-cream symbol you can make the same with a child.

When a player has moved their figures, the turn is completed, and it is now the turn of another player.

The game ends when a boy and a donkey arrive at the market together. The player whose donkey and boy get to the market first wins the game.

Name: Guardians of Fire: Holy Order
Description:
The Knights Templar lead by Grandmaster Michael face a new foe: unusual Demons. Grandmaster Michael has found these foes are more cunning and have an array of cruel weapons. Alongside his Brothers in Arms, he will vanquish this threat.

—description from the designer

Name: BrewCards
Description:
BrewCards is the ultimate pub game.  Designed to be played with a pint, BrewCards is a fast-paced card and dice game where players compete to brew the most and best recipes, and if they are lucky, an Awesome Brew along the way.  Collect Hops, Grain, Yeast, and Water cards for a basic brew and add Adjuncts or Barrel Aging for a more complex recipe.  Roll the dice to see if your brew is successful and maybe even so good that it earns the honor of being an Awesome Brew!

Players draw cards from the deck and lay them down to complete beer recipes, collecting points. Brew as many successful beer recipes as possible. The player with most points wins. Each successful brew and every Awesome Brew token counts as a point.

Name: BattleTech: Technical Readout – Jihad
Description:
November 3067 saw the culmination of work two centuries in the making, work begun by Primus Conrad Toyama of ComStar, successor to Jerome Blake and the man responsible for single-handedly turning ComStar into a pseudo-religious organization with a vision: to lead mankind to the light.

But then the Second Star League collapsed .

Denied their dream, the Blakists fought to preserve the Star League against the follies of the Great Houses, its fanaticism manifested as the Jihad: a horrific war that pitted every nation against each other. This era saw bleeding edge machines march off to war, while venerable ’Mechs continued to receive upgrades and facelifts. Even primitive ’Mechs not seen in over half a millennia once again appear on the battlefield.

Technical Readout: Jihad expands on Technical Readout: Succession Wars and Technical Readout: Clan Invasion by combining the ’Mechs previously found in Technical Readout: 3050 Upgrade, Technical Readout: 3055 Upgrade, Technical Readout: 3058 Upgrade, Technical Readout: 3060, Technical Readout: 3067, Technical Readout: 3075, Technical Readout: 3085, and Technical Readout: Project Phoenix. Each machine is accompanied by an illustration, a description of its history, capabilities, and game stats.

Name: Tricky Street
Description:
It’s a city jungle - cars, traffic lights, road works. And all mail trucks are full of parcels waiting for delivery. How to break through those jungles and become first who delivers all the parcels?

Each player chooses a truck and fills it with parcels, when the trucks are full, the game starts. Player, who has the turn, should check the address to which the first parcel should be delivered (on the first card in his mail truck). Address is indicated with the colour and number on the card.
 After checking where is the address on the board and what are the obstacles, the player should choose: to roll both dice; to roll either traffic light or “road works” dice; not to roll any dice. If you roll the traffic light dice, 
you need to place the traffic light on the black spot, according to rolled symbols. If you roll the “road works” dice, follow the same rules, just place the sign on the white spots.

Now you can drive with your mail truck on the street, following the arrows (one way street) and get as close to the address, as possible, to deliver the parcel.

You must always obey the traffic rules. Stop in front of the red traffic light or the “road works” sign. You will be able to drive further only when those obstacles will be removed.

The game ends when one of the players delivers their last parcel and wins the game.
Families: Theme: Mail / Stamps / The Post Office

Name: Catena vitae
Description:
Catena Vitae means in Latin: The Chain of Life

The aim of the game is to create the chain of life with tangent chessmen of the same colour

9x8 chessboard from the Octonovem series
Each player has ten pieces. They are arranged in alternating rows for five pieces on each row with empty square between each other. White has pieces on 2ed and 5th row,  Black has pieces on 4th and 7th row.

General rules of the game:
The pawns move three free spaces vertically and horizontally, turning only one time (but you can't jump over any pawns)
If any pawn (own or the opponent’s one) is placed on the last square, you can take its place by moving it one free space in the direction of the last move.
When the moving pawn, own or foreign, has no free square to move in the same direction, then it is removed from the board
After the initiating movement, whether any of the pawns has been moved or taken off the board, the opponent has to move.

The end of the game:
The player who created the chain of life wins ... what means that all his pawns are connected in one continuous chain, not necessarily closed (connecting vertically or / and horizontally, or / and diagonally).
Independently from creating the chain of life the player looses the game when all of his/her pawns are placed on one colour of the field.

Name: Jenga: Party
Description: Gather your friends and get ready to party with this class wood block game.  Jenga Party has a fun new element: pull out a block and answer a question, such as: What shouldn't you say to your boss? or What personal qualities shouldn't you exaggerate about?  It'll have you and your friends stacking, asking, and laughing, but remember - don't let them topple

Name: Domowe zwierzaki
Description:
The little ones we care for, quickly become our best friends. We love our pets - we feed them, we take care of them and play together. It does not matter if it is a cheerful dog, purring kitty, cute hamster or a kind turtle. Take care of your four-legged companions and see how worth it.Your pet will surely appreciate it!

Domowe zwierzaki is a new game from the child-friendly world award competition! Game series for preschooler. In Domowe zwierzaki, the youngest players will have the opportunity to learn about running a farm. The game includes several gameplay variants, so everyone will find something for themselves.

Variant 1: Animal caretaker

Where you take care of your animal and you meet his needs, by completing quests.

First you spin the arrow and see what exactly needs
your pet in this turn. This will create kind of minigames. Feeding, Care, Cleaning, Play, Care. When you succesfully do the task you willtake the price token. Game ends immidiately when player collects five price tokens.

Variant 2: Walk with a dog

Where you go for a walk with your dog, this is a kind of race, mode.

First you Spin the arrow and move your pawn to the next square in the drawn color. If the pawn stops
on the special field. (Toy. Bridge, Ball) You will get some additional or lose pawn moves. Whoever puts a pawn at the finish line first, wins the game and wins the cup!

Variant 3: Zoo-mino

This is easy version of domino game, where you also train your memory.

Your task is to add chips to those on the table (from first
or second end of the row). The player may add a token to which is on the table, provided that it has the same background color or there is the same animal on it. After a player adds a tile, he draws one from the pile. If there is no suitable tile to be added, he also draws one from the stack. When the stack is empty, players take the final turn without drawing. If the player cannot play the chip, he says "pass". The winner is the player with the fewest chips.

Name: Chapter 2: Warehouse on the Wharf
Description:
An escape room experience from the Curious Correspondence Club. The first season is broken into 12 chapters, of which Warehouse on the Wharf is the second in the series.

You will work through a series of puzzles to solve each chapter at your own pace with a digital hint system available if needed.

Chapter II takes you to Padstow Wharf to find the second of 12 ancient artifacts hidden among the hundreds of shipments arriving and leaving the warehouse.

Hot on the heels of another agent who went missing in action, you must use the map, film negative, and cargo panels she left behind to piece together the artifact’s location before it is moved and lost forever.

---

Audience
Recommended for 12+; younger players may require guidance from an adult. Designed to be played either solo or collaboratively, and takes an average of 60-90 minutes to solve, though players can work through them at their own pace.

Difficulty
Each Chapter of The CCC is supported by a dedicated digital hint library, allowing you to choose how many additional clues you receive. From subtle nudges all the way to complete solutions for each puzzle, it's up to you to choose your level of difficulty.

Name: Chapter 3: The Tinker's Trinket
Description:
An escape room experience from the Curious Correspondence Club. The first season is broken into 12 chapters, of which, The Tinker's Trinket is the third.

You will work through a series of puzzles to solve each chapter at your own pace with a digital hint system available if needed.

In this chapter, you take a trip to the Open Bazaar Trading Commission and meet a mysterious tinker with a peculiar trinket. He has promised to share a secret with you if you can figure out his name.

You must repair the trinket, discover his name, and gain access to the knowledge he has to share to help your hunt for the 12 lost shards.

---

Audience
Recommended for 12+; younger players may require guidance from an adult. Designed to be played either solo or collaboratively, and takes an average of 60-90 minutes to solve, though players can work through them at their own pace.

Difficulty
Each Chapter of The CCC is supported by a dedicated digital hint library, allowing you to choose how many additional clues you receive. From subtle nudges all the way to complete solutions for each puzzle, it's up to you to choose your level of difficulty.

Name: Honolulu
Description: Honolulu is a fast and lightweight engine builder that plays in about 60 minutes for ages 10 and up. The game takes place on a market. Try to suit the needs of your customers and fulfill their demands.

Name: Flesh and Blood: Tales of Aria
Description:
The protectors of Isenloft awaken from their endless winter slumber.  The wardens of Candlehold sharpen their thorns within the blossoming undergrowth.  The prophets of Volthaven set their sights on a future painted by the great aurora.

Tales of Aria is a standalone booster set for Flesh and Blood introducing three new heroes with all new character mechanics, as we explore the vibrant land of Aria and the troubles that lie within.  Designed for exceptional sealed deck, booster draft, and constructed format play.

Available in "Blitz Decks" (ready-to-play out of the box) and "Booster" (foil packs of a selection from 238 new cards)

Name: Possessed
Description:
In the early 1900s, an old house forgotten for 20 years has been discovered by a group of supernatural investigators. Following rumors of the haunting, they come to the house and begin to explore. As the daylight fades they make for the exit, but they are locked in! What’s more, an evil spirit has possessed one of them, but no one knows who. Desperately, they scramble to uncover the secret of the house before time runs out, wary all the while that they can trust no one. Welcome to Possessed, a fast-paced game of exploration, supernatural forces, and treachery. Can you survive the night?

Players take turns drawing cards from the house deck, representing the rooms they are searching. Clue cards will be claimed as points at the end of the game, and you may trade these with other players to make sets worth additional points. However, should you draw too many Ghosts or Despair in one round, you risk losing those points. You must decide whether to hide from the Ghosts and drop out of the round, or push your luck and risk losing it all.

At some point in the game, the Possessed will reveal who they are. From now on they will attempt to thwart the investigators using the cards they have accumulated throughout the game. Can the investigators collect enough clues before three rounds are up? Or will they be overwhelmed by the Possessed and the terrors of the haunted mansion?

Name: Sagrada: Promo 14 – Game Boy Geek 2021 Window Pattern Card
Description: A promo window pattern for Sagrada included in the 2021 Game Boy Geek Kickstarter.

Name: 俠客集 (Wuxia Collection)
Description:
Wuxia Collection is a simple card board game. In the game, three actions of "draw card", "pick card" and "grab card" will be used to change your hand combination and try to make your hand combination higher Score, the player with the highest score after settlement wins. In order to enhance the player's sense of substitution, a unique background text is written on each card, bringing the martial arts spirit of the novel directly into the game. Not only that, but also invited the Artist Reddo, who specializes in martial arts field drawing, to draw the illustrations. The ink-and-wash style illustrations are believed to make the players more visually satisfied.

—description from the publisher

Name: 7 Wonders Duel: Agora – Tu Quoque Fili Promo Card
Description:
A new Conspiracy card to add to the 16 regular ones in the 7 Wonders Duel: Agora expansion.

Rules: You can copy the effect of another Conspiracy card already triggered by you or your opponent.

Name: Micro Dojo: Loyalty + Deceit
Description:
Your hard work in Micro Dojo drew the eye of the Shogun, but also gained the attention of two rival clans that now try to claim the town for their own.

The Shinchoku clan bring progress and prosperity, whilst the Tsuyo clan cultivate power and corruption.

Pledge your loyalty, earn support, and help your chosen clan come to power.

Name: Narrato
Description:
Narrato is a therapeutic boardgame where we invite players to enter the space between fiction and reality, between game and therapy.

Narrato takes players on an exploration hike through the many meaningful maps (domains) in their lives. It is a semi-cooperative game that you can play solo, with your partner, with (a) friend(s), with your family, with co-workers. The explorers (players) have total control on how to engage in the gameworld ('agency'). Under the supervision of a 'narrator', players explore a diversity of domains of meaning in close cooperation with each other. There are several domains of meaning in the game that can be chosen and are puzzled in a game board: neighbourhood, relationship, freetime, family, household, work, friends and school. In each domain you will face questions, exercises and challenges depending on the chosen mission. You gain 'join' points by doing missions and by engaging in the missions of other explorers.

The game ends after a fixed amount of gathered missions (depending on how long you want to play: between 1 hour and 3 hours) and the explorer with the most 'join' points (victory points), wins.

In a search for new ways to 'do psychotherapy', we offer in this board game an unseen constellation of play and therapy, where we let go of the necessary presence of a therapist in the therapeutic process. Narrato is a board game that has it's inspiration from concepts within the narrative psychotherapy and systemic psychotherapy. In an atmosphere of fun and connection, players remember not only rich stories but they also write new ones with the playing of Narrato. Players can get connected in surprising ways and through the specific design of the game. We expect new kinds of experiences for themselves, their partner, their family, friends and other meaningful persons in life.  Increasing each other's sense of influence is rewarded ('relational agency’) through 'join' points.

Name: Cardline: Animaux mini-extension
Description: The magazine "Manga Kids" N°44 (July-August 2013) offers an unpublished "sample" of cardline animals, which contains 32 cards different from the basic box.

Name: Swipe
Description:
Dating apps are full of unknown people, and until we get to know them better, we have stereotypical thinking, right? How can you choose a person, having only their appearance and just a little bit of info about personality? Imagine there is a fragile charming girl and a handsome athlete guy in front of you — which of them looks so reliable that you would take him or her with you to the ISS? What if the girl spoils the series but is a jack-of-all-trades, and the guy is the passive-aggressive mom's friend's son? What will you do: swipe right or ignore?

Swipe is a party game with extremely simple rules. At the start of a round, one player becomes the leader and closes their eyes. Another player draws two character cards from the deck and places them in slots 1 and 2 in the plastic organizer to make them easy to see, then draws an action card from the deck and places it between these characters. Each player other than the leader receives a goal card that shows either 1 or 2 — and your job is to make the leader pick that character so that you score 1 point.

On your turn, give characters trait cards — whether positive or negative — by playing them from your hand. The leader then chooses the character to whom they will apply the action drawn at the beginning of the round: to kill, to marry, to have sex with, etc. All the players whose character was chosen receive 1 point.

Whoever has the most points at the end of the game wins.

Name: Damnlands
Description:
Damnlands :a long time ago, Great Old Ones breached into our world and wrecked chaos and disasters. Humanity managed to survive by combining magic and science, building grate city fortresses. Now after 500 years the Great Old Ones are trying to breach again. A group of exceptional investigators adventurers must break their plans and discover whereabouts of their Avatars (Nemesis) to destroy them...

Damnlands is a turn based, action-selection, rss management, adventure, co-op, variable player powers game, from 1 to 5 players.

On their turn, players will upgrade their characters with cards, resolve skill tests on location and fight minions. Good cooperation is required to ensure success!

Players activate their skills icons with cubes and move on a board.

The game ends if Nemesis track reach the end. Players win when they found and destroy Nemesis in combat.

Name: Battle Blocks: Sengoku
Description:
Play out fast and simple battles during the Sengoku period in Japan! Streamlined and simple rules allow for games to be played in 20-30 minutes. Using home made blocks, and simple terrain (or no terrain at all!) as well as the included unit counters allows players to quickly construct an attractive looking game which can be taken almost anywhere.

Each turn the players roll a die to determine initiative for the round. Play then proceeds into the command phase where players spend action points on moving their blocks around on the board. The game ends when one player defeats the other by destroying 4 of their opponent's blocks.

Players can use 3D terrain, hand drawn maps, or just a kitchen table to play on. The goal of the design is so make wargaming as easy and simple as possible to get into. The use of coloured blocks and action dice also means the transition to wargaming is made easier for those who currently only play traditional board and counter games.

Movement is regulated in inches using tape measures or home made measuring sticks and the rules of the game fit onto a single side of A4.

Name: ¿Qué País Soy?: Europa
Description:
Trivial type game, with questions and challenges about the 50 Eurasian countries.

The game consists of 100 cards, 1 dice and 100 videos on YouTube.
Capital, language, currency and other questions about countries are what you will have to get right to accumulate cards and beat your rivals. The player with the highest number of cards wins the game.

The game has questions in QR codes that link to videos in which the location, anthem and images of a country will appear that you will have to get right before a countdown ends.


Juego tipo trivial, con preguntas y retos sobre los 50 países euroasiáticos.
El juego está formado por 100 cartas, 1 dado y 100 vídeos en Youtube.
Capital, idioma, moneda y otras preguntas sobre países son las que tendrás que acertar para ir acumulando cartas y ganar a tus rivales.
El juego tiene preguntas en códigos QR que enlazan con vídeos en los que te aparecerá la ubicación, himno e imágenes de un país que tendrás que acertar antes que finalice una cuenta atrás.

Name: Magic Maze: Zwischengeschosse
Description: Promo tiles A, B and C to expand the mall. None of these tiles require the expansion.

Name: Splintered Lands
Description:
Splintered Lands is a post-apocalypse-themed expandable deck-building game from Civil Dawn Games. Players take on the role of an enclave governor who must lead their people in a fight for survival using a brand new base-defense tactical deck-building game mechanic.

Somehow, you have cobbled together a band of basic fighting men and women to help you survive in the inhospitable wasteland you call home. However, you’ve noticed another group of survivors competing for resources in your area. If you are going to survive for long, you are going to need to spend your ever-dwindling resources to convince new and capable people to join you in the constant struggle...but finding them can be just as difficult as convincing them to come back with you.

Players take turns attacking their opponent, fortifying their enclave, and searching the Dunes to acquire new and powerful characters to join their fight. Defeat your opponent by crippling their authority, and do it quickly -- your opponent will only grow stronger the longer you let them live. Unfortunately, they know it, too.

Each player starts the game with an 11 card deck. Then players choose which factions they want to be represented. Combine your favorite three factions to create the six card Dunes deck. This is where you will find powerful allies to join your enclave. On their turn, players play cards, pick cards, and arrange/navigate cards on their side. The game ends when one player has had their Authority (life) reduced to 0 due to actions happening in the game. A player wins by reducing their opponents Authority (life) to 0 or below.

Along with the four starting factions, Splintered Lands has five expansions already planned out. Each expansion contains two new factions, plus exclusive bonus content. These unique boosters create new ways to engage with the world of Splintered Lands, giving players optional new ways to defeat their opponents, new and interesting mechanics to discover, and unusual aberrant creatures to defend with or against.

Name: Literatio
Description:
A new game for people who like word games, crosswords and other educational, challenging family friendly games.

Literatio is a game of word creation where 2 to 5 players build words from cards drawn with cards used from preceding players’ words to ultimately achieve the highest score. A player’s word is scored by the numeric value of each letter plus the total number of cards used.  Each word played after the first must contain at least one card from the previous word and at least one card from their hand. A fast, portable word making game that's also fun as a solitaire game.

Literatio comes in a cloth draw-string bag containing 100 small laminated letter cards, instructions, pencil, and score sheets.

Player One builds as high a scoring word as he can. For example, 8 points for the total of the numerical values of the letters 
plus 6 points for the number of cards used.

Player Two discards one card from Player One's word into a used letter pool and rearranges the remaining letters while adding at least one of his own to make a new word.  Play continues until all cards have been drawn and one of the players has used all of his cards or until all possible words are played. The value of the 
unused cards that players are unable to play are subtracted from their scores.

The player with the highest score wins! Players may use a timer if desired.

Name: Sector
Description:
WINNER of Best Innovative Mechanic in the 10th Roll and Write Design Contest
RUNNER UP in Best Written Rules, Best Game Sheet and Best Multiplayer Game

A FREE One Page low ink Print And Play long-form fantasy game of search and rescue in the depths of space.

You can’t remember how long you have searched but somehow you have kept going. Your ship just barely holding together you find yourself dazed and adrift in uncharted Space. You will have to scrape together all the resources you can to survive and maybe, at long last just maybe, find The Lost Pilot.

Accompanied by a unique soundtrack (linked by QR code on the playing map) and using just a couple of dice and some coloured pens, one to three players must each navigate this SECTOR of space in order to find their Lost Pilot and escape. But along the way they will have to face terrifying creatures, a crumbling ship and ultimately each other.

Link to a print copy of the Playing Map
https://boardgamegeek.com/filepage/229289/sector-map

Link to a PDF copy of the rules
https://boardgamegeek.com/filepage/229298/sector-rules

And the current development thread is here. It also contains everything you need to download and play and you’ll find a link to the Carpenter/Vangelis/Badalamenti inspired soundtrack there too. 
https://boardgamegeek.com/thread/2727772/wip-search-and-rescue-depths-space-soundtrack-play

Name: Rivals for Catan: Hostel Scenario
Description:
This is a free official print & play scenario released during the 2020 pandemic.

From the scenario: 
All of us are longing for eateries, hotels, and B & Bs to reopen. Fortunately, there are still hostels on Catan that offer traveling merchants excellent room and board. You can use these special hostel cards as an addition to the Rivals for CATAN™
introductory game and when playing the theme games.
Families: Series: Free PnP during 2019-2020 COVID-19 Pandemic (Asmodee)

Name: Toast
Description:
Toast is a handmade scrambled word game where players race to form words of 4 or more letters and collect the most tiles by the end of the game.  Seven tiles are face-up on the table, and the first player to see a word of 4+ letters among them calls it out, collects those letters, and replaces them from the draw pile.  After all tiles are flipped and no more words can be made, the player with the most tiles wins.

Toast includes a drawstring fabric bag containing 131 individually word burned tiles and game directions.  The tiles are approximately 1"x 1", consisting of:
- 125 letter tiles.
- 3 buttered toast tiles, which can count as any letter. 
- 3 burnt toast tiles, which give the players who draw them -4 points each.

Name: Build Word Challenge
Description:
The Build Word Challenge deck is a game system with which many word games can be played.  The deck has 2 copies of each consonant, 4 copies of each vowel, and 2 star (wild) cards. The letter cards are also numbered 1-26 in alphabetical order, and the star card is 27. The letters and star are printed in 4 colors (red, blue, green, black), 2 on each card. The numbers and colors can be used for different games, change a game’s difficulty, and resolve ties.

The main Build Word Challenge game deals 7 cards to each player, and they each write down all the words they can find among them; then they pass their hand to the left and do the same with the new hand. This is repeated until each player has examined each hand, and then everyone scores all the words they found; highest score wins.

The rules booklet includes rules for word games based on many other popular games:

BWC Canasta
BWC Concentration 
BWC Cribbage
BWC Gin Rummy
BWC Go Fish
BWC Pass the Deck
BWC Poker
BWC Rack-O 
BWC Scrabble 
BWC Seven 
BWC Solitaire (5 different games)
BWC Spoons
BWC Trash 
BWC UNO
BWC War
BWC 2Plus
BWC 56 Sticks
BWC 900 Rummy

Name: Crews of Eridanus
Description:
"Crews of Eridanus" is a science fiction-themed board game of exploration and adventure for 1–6 players. Playing time is normally 2 hours.

Each player represents the Captain of a small in-system spacecraft that has been selected by the authorities to help get the system economy and travel back to normal. As a Captain, you’ll need to recruit a crew and good crews don’t come cheap. Crews of Eridanus is an open world and there are a number of ways to earn credits: carrying passengers, trading cargoes, mining, exploring wrecks and hunting pirates. All players start with the same size of crew, ship and resources, but they are free to pursue whatever strategy they think best. Each player builds a unique tableau consisting of different crew members and ship modifications.

The game is played over a series of rounds, with each player taking their respective turn. A player can usually take 3 actions per turn.

The game starts in a pirate phase, where pirate ships occupy a number of locations on the map.  If most of the pirates are destroyed, then the game shifts to a normal phase. Finally, the game enters an end phase after a pre-determined number of rounds have been played and a boss appears.

There are multiple ways to defeat the boss, but if it is not dealt with quickly then all of the players will lose. If the players are successful in stopping the boss, whoever has the most Victory Points is the winner.

Name: BIO
Description:
Bio takes the color/ card type matching mechanic we all know and love and turns it into an adrenaline-fueled fight for your life! Push, Run, Hide, and Kill your way through an endless horde of zombies in an attempt to be the first to escape the facility.

Players draw cards using a modified UNO game mechanic and try to escape before the deck runs out. Some cards can  turn players into Zombies.  When this happens, players still try to escape.

The first human player to get rid of all their cards (escapes), wins.  Alternatively, a zombie player must escape before the last human player dies.

As part of an elite biological threat elimination squad, you find yourself deep in the heart of an underground military complex known to be in possession of a deadly new chemical weapon. It quickly becomes clear things are far worse than expected when buried in the thick darkness of the subterranean halls you discover actual zombies!  The deafening roar of automatic gunfire erupts as you pump round after round into the horde, filling the narrow corridors with muzzle flashes and gore. As the sprinting river of gnashing teeth and rotting flesh pours out of the dark, you realize the futility of your defense and turn back toward the exit. Overwhelmed and starving for ammo the mission priority shifts from completion.. to survival.

Can you escape this nightmare? Or will you become part of it?

Name: אלפא (Alpha)
Description:
In Alpha, players try to lose their cards as quickly as possible, by matching colours or Hebrew letters. Some power cards mix up the gameplay to add some strategy.

—user summary

Name: Liar Liar: The Game of Truths and Lies
Description:
A Hilarious Party Game for all ages. Who's the best LIAR in your friend group?

Each round players share a short, personal statement relating to one of their topic cards. If you get the secret role of LIAR, you have to lie! Everybody else has to tell the truth. You win by identifying the liar, and by tricking your friends into thinking YOU are the liar.

The player who wins the most rounds, wins the game.

Name: HINT Promo
Description:
HINT is about hinting to your team-mates what YOU know. You can hint by talking, drawing, miming or humming. The better you are at hinting, the faster you can advance. But be careful about wild guesses, because there are things you are NOT allowed to guess. Get ready to play the #1 party game in Scandinavia.

—description from the publisher

WHAT IS THE GAME ABOUT? HINT is about hinting to your team-mates what YOU know. You can hint by talking, drawing, miming or humming.

The better you are at hinting, the faster you can advance. But be careful about wild guesses, because there are things you are NOT allowed to guess! Teams take turns and the one with the highest score when all 20 cards have been played wins!

Promotional game has 20 cards.
Families: Series: Free PnP during 2019-2020 COVID-19 Pandemic (Asmodee)

Name: Het IQ Spel
Description:
Solve puzzles and questions in 5 categories: language, math, spatial visualization, logic, general knowledge. Get enough right in each category before anyone else to win.

—user summary

Name: BattleTech: Technical Readout – Irregulars
Description:
Fall of 3134. After decades of peace and prosperity, interstellar communications broke down two years ago, and conflict is sweeping through the Republic of the Sphere.

As ancient hatreds and rivalries rear their ugly heads, people who have only known war through history books are suddenly thrust into the dark maelstrom of combat. Splinter factions have arisen, aligning themselves with fealties long thought forgotten, and stalking each other on Republic worlds like jackals. Often lacking military-grade equipment, these groups and defending militias deploy SecurityMechs, Support Vehicles, or even modified civilian machinery in their desperate struggle to prevail.

Technical Readout: Irregulars unveils the weapons deployed during the chaos after Gray Monday when paramilitaries warred in the Republic’s outer Prefectures. Technical Readout: Irregulars debuts the production and custom machines used by splinter factions in 3132 and afterward. Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 25 new IndustrialMech MODs, Security- and MilitiaMechs, support vehicles, and their variants ready for play.

Name: Brick & Mortar: Promo Starting Stores
Description: Pack of 2 new starting stores that provide early access to the jewelry and art markets. Use these alongside the existing starting stores to add more variability to the early rounds of the game.  Kickstarter promo

Name: Schinderhannes 1803
Description:
Soonwald 1802 - Schinderhannes the robber is on the run.

The players try to find out where Schinderhannes committed which crime. To do this, follow the various instructions on the info cards. Reference markers are placed on the possible locations and help with research.

Using the exclusion principle, indicator markers can gradually be removed again until a crime has been precisely identified for a location.

The players are rewarded the more information they provide.

The game ends when there is a crime disc on each town and thus all offenses and their locations have been determined.

The player with the most points wins.
Families: Series: Thinker games for one player (Clicker Spiele)

Name: Nightmare at the Rockport Caverns
Description:
Nightmare at the Rockport is a roll and write game where you and a friend are spelunkers exploring the caverns. While in the caverns, an earthquake hits the area and catastrophic geologic nightmare ensues. Rock slides block pathways and the water begins to rise from the lowest point of the caverns. To make matters worse, in all the confusion, your friend gets injured and separated from you in the caverns. Your goal is to find your injured friend and escape out of the caverns before the water overtakes you. If you run out of Life points, unable to escape the caverns, or you are overtaken by the rising waters, you lose!

Each turn you will roll for two rock slides. Next, you will raise the water level in the caverns. You will then take two actions to either move, climb, dig. After completing your actions, you will roll for an event. Two of these can be beneficial ... but don't get your hopes up! The event die can really thwart your effort to get out of the caverns.

Once you get to close enough, you will call out to your friend and the location of your friend will be revealed. You will then trudge your way through the caverns to reconnect and escape out of the caverns.

Name: #_Hashtag
Description:
In this Roll & Write game, you roll 2 dice each turn and record the result of one in your sheet (a small paper with 9 boxes like a Hashtag).  The other die is available for the player to your right.  But only in the 4 boxes upper-left of this matrix, because the last column and the last row you must record the result of a mathematical operation from preceding boxes (addition or subtraction). These are the double boxes.

When you have a double box, you can choose the result of two dice thrown by any player and score it in your sheet.

The first player who mark his 5 double boxes first will be the winner, and the game ends.

Name: Lunar Base: Kickstarter Limited Edition Extra Cards
Description:
A Kickstarter-exclusive set of 12 extra cards for Lunar Base.


     4 Stations (Braun, Kafka, Korolev, Tipu)
     8 Influences (Blood Moon, Credit Reform, Free Market, Longevity, Metamorphosis, Moonstone Cops, Transparency, Welfare)
     1 Descriptive card (not playable)


just for the 2078 backers.

Name: Il dono del Nilo
Description:
Two players take turns in covering the Nile valley with silt.

The chessboard has 7 x 7 squares. On their turn, the player places a tile that covers two adjacent squares on the board. Tiles cannot be placed on top one another.

If the player is unable to lay down a tile, the game ends and he loses the game.

This board game is a themed version of a traditional paper & pencil games called Playing Last.

—description by the designer

Published on History Kids, italian edition, issue #7.

Name: Latvijas Neatkarības Karš 1918-1920
Description:
